original: Tatrāvuso, bhikkhunā attanāva attānaṁ evaṁ anuminitabbaṁ:
analyzed: tatra āvuso bhikkhunā attanāva attānam evam
translated: “A monk should infer about himself in this way:

original: ‘yo khvāyaṁ puggalo pāpiccho, pāpikānaṁ icchānaṁ vasaṁ gato, ayaṁ me puggalo appiyo amanāpo;
analyzed: yaḥ khvā ayam puggalaḥ pāpa icchaḥ pāpikānam icchānam vasam gataḥ ayam me puggalaḥ appiyaḥ amanāpaḥ
translated: ‘The person who is evil, who is overcome by evil wishes, is unappealing and disagreeable to me.

original: ahañceva kho panassaṁ pāpiccho pāpikānaṁ icchānaṁ vasaṁ gato, ahampāssaṁ paresaṁ appiyo amanāpo’ti.
analyzed: aham ca iva kho panassam pāpicchaḥ pāpikānam icchānam vasam gataḥ aham pāssam paresam appiyaḥ amanāpaḥ ti
translated: If I were to be evil, overcome by evil wishes, I too would be unappealing and disagreeable to others.’

original: Evaṁ jānantenāvuso, bhikkhunā ‘na pāpiccho bhavissāmi, na pāpikānaṁ icchānaṁ vasaṁ gato’ti cittaṁ uppādetabbaṁ.
analyzed: evam jānantena āvuso bhikkhunā na pāpicchaḥ bhavissāmi na pāpikānam icchānam vasam gataḥ ti cittam uppādetabba
translated: When a monk knows thus, he should arouse his mind to enter into the unappealing.

original: ‘Yo khvāyaṁ puggalo attukkaṁsako paravambhī, ayaṁ me puggalo appiyo amanāpo;
analyzed: yaḥ khvā ayam puggalaḥ attukkasakaḥ paravambhī ayam me puggalaḥ appiyaḥ amanāpaḥ
translated: ‘The person who praises himself and disparages others is unappealing and disagreeable to me.

original: ahañceva kho panassaṁ attukkaṁsako paravambhī, ahampāssaṁ paresaṁ appiyo amanāpo’ti.
analyzed: aham ca iva kho panassam attukkasakaḥ paravambhī aham pāssam paresam appiyaḥ amanāpaḥ ti
translated: If I were to praise myself and disparage others, I too would be unappealing and disagreeable to others.’

original: Evaṁ jānantenāvuso, bhikkhunā ‘anattukkaṁsako bhavissāmi aparavambhī’ti cittaṁ uppādetabbaṁ.
analyzed: evam jānantena āvuso bhikkhunā anattukkasakaḥ bhavissāmi a paravambhī iti cittam uppādetabba
translated: When a monk knows thus, he should arouse his mind to enter into the unappealing.

original: ‘Yo khvāyaṁ puggalo kodhano kodhābhibhūto, ayaṁ me puggalo appiyo amanāpo.
analyzed: yaḥ khvā ayam puggalaḥ kodhanaḥ kodha abhibhūtaḥ ayam me puggalaḥ appiyaḥ amanāpaḥ
translated: ‘The person who is angry and overcome by anger is displeasing and disagreeable to me.

original: Ahañceva kho panassaṁ kodhano kodhābhibhūto, ahampāssaṁ paresaṁ appiyo amanāpo’ti.
analyzed: aham ca iva kho panassam kodhanaḥ kodha abhibhūtaḥ aham pāssam paresam appiyaḥ amanāpaḥ ti
translated: But if I were to be angry and overcome by anger, I would be displeasing and disagreeable to others.’

original: Evaṁ jānantenāvuso, bhikkhunā ‘na kodhano bhavissāmi na kodhābhibhūto’ti cittaṁ uppādetabbaṁ.
analyzed: evam jānantena āvuso bhikkhunā na kodhanaḥ bhavissāmi na kodha abhibhūtaḥ ti cittam uppādetabba
translated: When a monk knows this, he should arouse his mind to: ‘I will not be angry and overcome by anger.’

original: ‘Yo khvāyaṁ puggalo kodhano kodhahetu upanāhī, ayaṁ me puggalo appiyo amanāpo;
analyzed: yaḥ khvā ayam puggalaḥ kodhanaḥ kodha hetu upanāhī ayam me puggalaḥ appiyaḥ amanāpaḥ
translated: ‘The person who is angry and because of anger is spiteful is displeasing and disagreeable to me.

original: ahañceva kho panassaṁ kodhano kodhahetu upanāhī, ahampāssaṁ paresaṁ appiyo amanāpo’ti.
analyzed: aham ca iva kho panassam kodhanaḥ kodha hetu upanāhī aham pāssam paresam appiyaḥ amanāpaḥ ti
translated: But if I were to be angry and because of anger be spiteful, I would be displeasing and disagreeable to others.’

original: Evaṁ jānantenāvuso, bhikkhunā ‘na kodhano bhavissāmi na kodhahetu upanāhī’ti cittaṁ uppādetabbaṁ.
analyzed: evam jānantena āvuso bhikkhunā na kodhanaḥ bhavissāmi na kodha hetu upanāhi iti cittam uppādetabba
translated: When a monk knows this, he should arouse his mind to: ‘I will not be angry and because of anger be spiteful.’

original: ‘Yo khvāyaṁ puggalo kodhano kodhahetu abhisaṅgī, ayaṁ me puggalo appiyo amanāpo;
analyzed: yaḥ khvā ayam puggalaḥ kodhanaḥ kodha hetu abhisaṅgī ayam me puggalaḥ appiyaḥ amanāpaḥ
translated: ‘The person who is angry and because of anger is resentful is displeasing and disagreeable to me.

original: ahañceva kho panassaṁ kodhano kodhahetu abhisaṅgī, ahampāssaṁ paresaṁ appiyo amanāpo’ti.
analyzed: aham ca iva kho panassam kodhanaḥ kodha hetu abhisaṅgī aham pāssam paresam appiyaḥ amanāpaḥ ti
translated: But if I were to be angry and because of anger be resentful, I would be displeasing and disagreeable to others.’

original: Evaṁ jānantenāvuso, bhikkhunā ‘na kodhano bhavissāmi na kodhahetu abhisaṅgī’ti cittaṁ uppādetabbaṁ.
analyzed: evam jānantena āvuso bhikkhunā na kodhanaḥ bhavissāmi na kodha hetu cittam uppādetabba
translated: When a monk knows this, he should arouse his mind to: ‘I will not be angry or full of hatred, nor will I speak words motivated by anger.’

original: ‘Yo khvāyaṁ puggalo kodhano kodhasāmantā vācaṁ nicchāretā, ayaṁ me puggalo appiyo amanāpo;
analyzed: yaḥ khvā ayam puggalaḥ kodhanaḥ kodha sāmantā vācam ayam me puggalaḥ appiyaḥ amanāpaḥ
translated: ‘When someone is angry and speaks words motivated by anger, I don’t like that person and I don’t enjoy it.

original: ahañceva kho panassaṁ kodhano kodhasāmantā vācaṁ nicchāretā, ahampāssaṁ paresaṁ appiyo amanāpo’ti.
analyzed: aham ca iva kho panassam kodhanaḥ kodha sāmantā vācam nicchāretā aham pāssam paresam appiyaḥ amanāpā iti
translated: If I were to be angry and speak words motivated by anger, others wouldn’t like me or enjoy me either.’

original: Evaṁ jānantenāvuso, bhikkhunā ‘na kodhano bhavissāmi na kodhasāmantā vācaṁ nicchāressāmī’ti cittaṁ uppādetabbaṁ.
analyzed: evam jānantena āvuso bhikkhunā na kodhanaḥ bhavissāmi na kodha sāmantā vācam nicchāressāmi iti cittam uppādetabba
translated: When a monk knows this, he should arouse his mind to: ‘I will not be angry or speak words motivated by anger.’

original: ‘Yo khvāyaṁ puggalo codito codakena codakaṁ paṭippharati, ayaṁ me puggalo appiyo amanāpo;
analyzed: yaḥ khvā ayam puggalaḥ codito codakena codakam paṭippharati ayam me puggalaḥ appiyaḥ amanāpaḥ
translated: ‘When someone, when accused, accuses another in return, I don’t like that person and I don’t enjoy it.

original: ahañceva kho pana codito codakena codakaṁ paṭipphareyyaṁ, ahampāssaṁ paresaṁ appiyo amanāpo’ti.
analyzed: aham ca iva kho pana codito codakena codakam paṭipphareyya aham pāssam paresam appiyaḥ amanāpaḥ iti
translated: If I were to, when accused, accuse another in return, others wouldn’t like me or enjoy me either.’

original: Evaṁ jānantenāvuso, bhikkhunā ‘codito codakena codakaṁ nappaṭippharissāmī’ti cittaṁ uppādetabbaṁ.
analyzed: evam jānantena āvuso bhikkhunā coditaḥ codakena codakam na paṭippharissāmi iti cittam uppādetabba
translated: When a monk knows this, he should arouse his mind to: ‘When accused, I will not accuse another in return.’

original: ‘Yo khvāyaṁ puggalo codito codakena codakaṁ apasādeti, ayaṁ me puggalo appiyo amanāpo;
analyzed: yaḥ khvā ayam puggalaḥ coditaḥ codakena codakam apasādeti ayam me puggalaḥ appiyaḥ amanāpaḥ
translated: ‘When someone else is accusing someone, if I were to accuse the accuser, I would not be dear or beloved or agreeable to others.

original: ahañceva kho pana codito codakena codakaṁ apasādeyyaṁ, ahampāssaṁ paresaṁ appiyo amanāpo’ti.
analyzed: aham ca iva kho pana codito codakena codakam apasādeyya aham pāssam paresam appiyaḥ amanāpā iti
translated: But if I, when being accused, do not accuse the accuser, I will be dear and beloved and agreeable to others.’

original: Evaṁ jānantenāvuso, bhikkhunā ‘codito codakena codakaṁ na apasādessāmī’ti cittaṁ uppādetabbaṁ.
analyzed: evam jānantena āvuso bhikkhunā coditaḥ codakena codakam na apasādessāmi iti cittam uppādetabba
translated: When a monk knows this, he should arouse his mind to: ‘I will not accuse the accuser when being accused.’

original: ‘Yo khvāyaṁ puggalo codito codakena codakassa paccāropeti, ayaṁ me puggalo appiyo amanāpo;
analyzed: yaḥ khvā ayam puggalaḥ coditaḥ codakena codakassa paccāropeti ayam me puggalaḥ appiyaḥ amanāpaḥ
translated: ‘When someone else is accusing someone, if I were to counter-accuse the accuser, I would not be dear or beloved or agreeable to others.

original: ahañceva kho pana codito codakena codakassa paccāropeyyaṁ, ahampāssaṁ paresaṁ appiyo amanāpo’ti.
analyzed: aham ca iva kho pana codito codakena codakassa paccāropeyya aham pāssam paresam appiyaḥ amanāpaḥ ti
translated: But if I, when being accused, do not counter-accuse the accuser, I will be dear and beloved and agreeable to others.’

original: Evaṁ jānantenāvuso, bhikkhunā ‘codito codakena codakassa na paccāropessāmī’ti cittaṁ uppādetabbaṁ.
analyzed: evam jānantena āvuso bhikkhunā coditaḥ codakena codakassa na paccāropessāmi iti cittam uppādetabba
translated: When a monk knows this, he should arouse his mind to: ‘I will not counter-accuse the accuser when being accused.’

original: ‘Yo khvāyaṁ puggalo codito codakena aññenaññaṁ paṭicarati, bahiddhā kathaṁ apanāmeti, kopañca dosañca appaccayañca pātukaroti, ayaṁ me puggalo appiyo amanāpo;
analyzed: yaḥ khvā ayam puggalaḥ coditaḥ codakena aññena aññam paṭicarati bahiddhā katham apanāmeti kopam ca dosam ca appaccayam ca pātukaroti ayam me puggalaḥ appiyaḥ amanāpaḥ
translated: ‘When someone else accuses me, if I counter-accuse them, evade the issue, get angry, and then leave the discussion, I’m displeasing and disagreeable to others.

original: ahañceva kho pana codito codakena aññenaññaṁ paṭicareyyaṁ, bahiddhā kathaṁ apanāmeyyaṁ, kopañca dosañca appaccayañca pātukareyyaṁ, ahampāssaṁ paresaṁ appiyo amanāpo’ti.
analyzed: aham ca iva kho pana codito codakena aññena aññam paṭicareyya bahiddhā katham apanāmeyya kopam ca dosam ca appaccayam ca pātukareyya aham pāssam paresam appiyaḥ amanāpaḥ iti
translated: But if I’m accused by someone else, I shouldn’t counter-accuse them, evade the issue, get angry, or leave the discussion. I should be pleasing and agreeable to others.’

original: Evaṁ jānantenāvuso, bhikkhunā ‘codito codakena na aññenaññaṁ paṭicarissāmi, na bahiddhā kathaṁ apanāmessāmi, na kopañca dosañca appaccayañca pātukarissāmī’ti cittaṁ uppādetabbaṁ.
analyzed: evam jānantena āvuso bhikkhunā coditaḥ codakena na aññena aññam paṭicarissāmi na bahiddhā katham apanāmessāmi na kopam ca dosam ca appaccayam ca pātukarissāmi iti cittam uppādetabba
translated: When you know this, you should arouse your mind to counter-accusation, evasion, anger, and leaving the discussion.

original: ‘Yo khvāyaṁ puggalo codito codakena apadāne na sampāyati, ayaṁ me puggalo appiyo amanāpo;
analyzed: yaḥ khvā ayam puggalaḥ coditaḥ codakena apadāne na sampāyati ayam me puggalaḥ appiyaḥ amanāpaḥ
translated: ‘When someone else accuses me, if I don’t make amends, I’m displeasing and disagreeable to others.

original: ahañceva kho pana codito codakena apadāne na sampāyeyyaṁ, ahampāssaṁ paresaṁ appiyo amanāpo’ti.
analyzed: aham ca iva kho pana codito codakena apadāne na sampāyeyya aham pāssam paresam appiyaḥ amanāpaḥ ti
translated: But if I’m accused by someone else, I should make amends. I should be pleasing and agreeable to others.’

original: Evaṁ jānantenāvuso, bhikkhunā ‘codito codakena apadāne sampāyissāmī’ti cittaṁ uppādetabbaṁ.
analyzed: evam jānantena āvuso bhikkhunā coditaḥ codakena apadāne sampāyissāmi iti cittam uppādetabba
translated: When a monk knows this, he should arouse his mind to ‘I will fulfill the conditions for not being charged with an offense when charged by one who is charging.’

original: ‘Yo khvāyaṁ puggalo makkhī paḷāsī, ayaṁ me puggalo appiyo amanāpo;
analyzed: yaḥ khvā ayam puggalaḥ makkhī paḷāsī ayam me puggalaḥ appiyaḥ amanāpaḥ
translated: ‘This person is contemptuous and arrogant. I don’t like or want such a person.

original: ahañceva kho panassaṁ makkhī paḷāsī, ahampāssaṁ paresaṁ appiyo amanāpo’ti.
analyzed: aham ca iva kho panassam makkhī paḷāsī aham pāssam paresam appiyaḥ amanāpaḥ ti
translated: But if I were contemptuous and arrogant, others wouldn’t like or want me either.’

original: Evaṁ jānantenāvuso, bhikkhunā ‘amakkhī bhavissāmi apaḷāsī’ti cittaṁ uppādetabbaṁ.
analyzed: evam jānantena āvuso bhikkhunā amakkhī bhavissāmi apaḷāsī iti cittam uppādetabba
translated: When a monk knows this, he should arouse his mind to ‘I will not be contemptuous and arrogant.’

original: ‘Yo khvāyaṁ puggalo issukī maccharī, ayaṁ me puggalo appiyo amanāpo;
analyzed: yaḥ khvā ayam puggalaḥ issukī maccharī ayam me puggalaḥ appiyaḥ amanāpaḥ
translated: ‘This person is envious and selfish. I don’t like or want such a person.

original: ahañceva kho panassaṁ issukī maccharī, ahampāssaṁ paresaṁ appiyo amanāpo’ti.
analyzed: aham ca iva kho panassam issukī maccharī aham pāssam paresam appiyaḥ amanāpaḥ iti
translated: But if I were envious and selfish, others wouldn’t like or want me either.’

original: Evaṁ jānantenāvuso, bhikkhunā ‘anissukī bhavissāmi amaccharī’ti cittaṁ uppādetabbaṁ.
analyzed: evam jānantena āvuso bhikkhunā anissukī bhavissāmi amaccharī iti cittam uppādetabba
translated: When a monk knows this, he should arouse his mind to ‘I will not be envious and selfish.’

original: ‘Yo khvāyaṁ puggalo saṭho māyāvī, ayaṁ me puggalo appiyo amanāpo;
analyzed: yaḥ khvā ayam puggalaḥ saṭhaḥ māyāvī ayam me puggalaḥ appiyaḥ amanāpaḥ
translated: ‘This person is deceitful and crafty. I don’t like or want such a person.

original: ahañceva kho panassaṁ saṭho māyāvī, ahampāssaṁ paresaṁ appiyo amanāpo’ti.
analyzed: aham ca iva kho panassam saṭhaḥ māyāvī aham pāssam paresam appiyaḥ amanāpaḥ ti
translated: But if I were deceitful and crafty, others wouldn’t like or want me either.’

original: Evaṁ jānantenāvuso, bhikkhunā ‘asaṭho bhavissāmi amāyāvī’ti cittaṁ uppādetabbaṁ.
analyzed: evam jānantena āvuso bhikkhunā asaṭhaḥ bhavissāmi amāyāvī iti cittam uppādetabba
translated: When a monk knows this, he should arouse his mind to be free of deceit and fraud.

original: ‘Yo khvāyaṁ puggalo thaddho atimānī, ayaṁ me puggalo appiyo amanāpo;
analyzed: yaḥ khvā ayam puggalaḥ thaddhaḥ atimānī ayam me puggalaḥ appiyaḥ amanāpaḥ
translated: ‘The person who is obstinate and arrogant is disliked and unloved by me.

original: ahañceva kho panassaṁ thaddho atimānī, ahampāssaṁ paresaṁ appiyo amanāpo’ti.
analyzed: aham ca iva kho panassam thaddhaḥ atimānī aham pāssam paresam appiyaḥ amanāpaḥ ti
translated: If I were obstinate and arrogant, I would be disliked and unloved by others.’

original: Evaṁ jānantenāvuso, bhikkhunā ‘atthaddho bhavissāmi anatimānī’ti cittaṁ uppādetabbaṁ.
analyzed: evam jānantena āvuso bhikkhunā atthaddhaḥ bhavissāmi anatimānī iti cittam uppādetabba
translated: When a monk knows this, he should arouse his mind to be free of obstinacy and arrogance.

original: ‘Yo khvāyaṁ puggalo sandiṭṭhiparāmāsī ādhānaggāhī duppaṭinissaggī, ayaṁ me puggalo appiyo amanāpo;
analyzed: yaḥ khvā ayam puggalaḥ sandiṭṭhi parāmāsī ādhāna ggāhī duppaṭinissaggī ayam me puggalaḥ appiyaḥ amanāpaḥ
translated: ‘The person who is devoted to his own views, who holds on to them tenaciously, and who relinquishes them with difficulty is disliked and unloved by me.

original: ahañceva kho panassaṁ sandiṭṭhiparāmāsī ādhānaggāhī duppaṭinissaggī, ahampāssaṁ paresaṁ appiyo amanāpo’ti.
analyzed: aham ca eva kho panassam sandiṭṭhi parāmāsī ādhāna ggāhī duppaṭinissaggī aham pāssam paresam appiyaḥ amanāpaḥ ti
translated: If I were devoted to my own views, if I held on to them tenaciously, and if I relinquished them with difficulty, I would be disliked and unloved by others.’

original: Evaṁ jānantenāvuso, bhikkhunā ‘asandiṭṭhiparāmāsī bhavissāmi anādhānaggāhī suppaṭinissaggī’ti cittaṁ uppādetabbaṁ.
analyzed: evam jānantena āvuso bhikkhunā a sandiṭṭhi parāmāsī bhavissāmi an ādhāna ggāhī suppaṭinissaggī iti cittam uppādetabba
translated: When a monk knows this, he should arouse his mind to be free of devotion to one’s own views, to the tenacious holding to them, and to their difficulty in being relinquished.

original: Tatrāvuso, bhikkhunā attanāva attānaṁ evaṁ paccavekkhitabbaṁ:
analyzed: tatra āvuso bhikkhunā attanā va attānam evam
translated: “Therein, friends, a monk should review it thus:

original: ‘kiṁ nu khomhi pāpiccho, pāpikānaṁ icchānaṁ vasaṁ gato’ti?
analyzed: kim nu khalu amhi pāpicchaḥ pāpikānam icchānam vasam gataḥ iti
translated: ‘Am I ill-willed, under the sway of bad desires?’

original: Sace, āvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṁ jānāti:
analyzed: sace āvuso bhikkhu paccavekkhamānaḥ evam jānāti
